title: Album Page, "Elevation of Loggia", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on smooth, thick off-white wove paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 132; bottom right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 28.
dimensions: Sheet: 24.2 x 11.4 cm (9 1/2 x 4 1/2 in.), irregular
description: Narrow vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding illustrating in upper half of sheet the elevation of a pointed arched loggia supported by nondescript columns.  Below this is a larger detail of four arches and the capitals of their column supports.  The verso contains an elevation with dimensions of a double arched window opening.  There are inscriptions with measurements on both the recto and verso; refer to image.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Elevation of Loggia", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Graphite on smooth, thick off-white wove paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-323.
